Container.Name: gitlab-ce
Container.Overview: GitLab Community Edition docker image based on the Omnibus package.

Config.Name: Web Interface Port (HTTP)
Config.Description: This is GitLab's Web UI port you can access via a web browser.

Config.Name: Web Interface Port (HTTPS)
Config.Description: This is GitLab's Web UI SSL port you can access via a web browser.

Config.Name: Config Storage Path
Config.Description: This is where GitLab will store its configuration files.

Config.Name: Application Data Storage Path
Config.Description: This is where GitLab will store its application data.

Config.Name: Log Storage Path
Config.Description: This is where GitLab will store its logs.

Config.Name: GITLAB_OMNIBUS_CONFIG
Config.Description: You can pre-configure the GitLab Docker image by adding the environment variable GITLAB_OMNIBUS_CONFIG to Docker run command. This variable can contain any gitlab.rb setting and is evaluated before the loading of the container’s gitlab.rb file. This behavior allows you to configure the external GitLab URL, and make database configuration or any other option from the Omnibus GitLab template. The settings contained in GITLAB_OMNIBUS_CONFIG aren’t written to the gitlab.rb configuration file, and are evaluated on load.
